title: Graph of derivative used to analyze function

content.question: The graph of the derivative of f is shown in the figure above. Which of the following could be the graph of f?

choices.label: A coordinate plane shows an oscillating curve plotted in all the four quadrants, which oscillates along the x-axis. The curve rises from quadrant 3, intersects the x-axis at a value of negative 1, and extends above the x-axis in quadrant 2. It then declines, passes through the origin, and extends below the x-axis in quadrant 4. It then rises again, intersects the x-axis at a value of 1, and extends above the x-axis in quadrant 1.

A coordinate plane shows an oscillating curve plotted in all the four quadrants, which oscillates along the x-axis. The curve rises from quadrant 3, intersects the x-axis at a value less than negative 1, and extends above the x-axis in quadrant 2, and peaks at a point with a value of negative 1 on the x-axis and a positive value on y-axis. It then declines, passes through the origin, and extends below the x-axis in quadrant 4, to a point with a value of 1 on the x-axis and a negative value on y-axis. It then rises again, intersects the x-axis at a value greater than 1, and extends above the x-axis in quadrant 1.

A coordinate plane shows an oscillating curve plotted in all the four quadrants, which oscillates along the x-axis. The curve declines from quadrant 2, intersects the x-axis at a value less than negative 1, and extends below the x-axis in quadrant 3, to a point with a value of negative 1 on the x-axis and a negative value on y-axis. It then rises, passes through the origin, and extends above the x-axis in quadrant 1, to a point with a value of 1 on the x-axis and a positive value on y-axis. It then declines again, intersects the x-axis at a value greater than 1, and extends below the x-axis in quadrant 4.
A coordinate plane shows a straight rising line with a positive slope, passing through the origin. It rises from quadrant 1 to quadrant 3. The values negative 1 and 1 are marked on the x-axis.
A coordinate plane shows a straight declining line with a negative slope, passing through the origin. It declines from quadrant 2 to quadrant 4. The values negative 1 and 1 are marked on the x-axis.

content.answer: A coordinate plane shows an oscillating curve plotted in all the four quadrants, which oscillates along the x-axis. The curve rises from quadrant 3, intersects the x-axis at a value less than negative 1, and extends above the x-axis in quadrant 2, and peaks at a point with a value of negative 1 on the x-axis and a positive value on y-axis. It then declines, passes through the origin, and extends below the x-axis in quadrant 4, to a point with a value of 1 on the x-axis and a negative value on y-axis. It then rises again, intersects the x-axis at a value greater than 1, and extends above the x-axis in quadrant 1.

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
